workflow.name: Sync Calendly bookings to Easy Redmine CRM with comments and sales activities
workflow.description:
**Sync New Calendly Bookings to Esko CRM with Comment, Sales Activity, and Outlook Email**

## Intro/Overview  
This automation workflow automatically syncs newly scheduled Calendly meetings into Easy Redmine CRM. When a meeting is booked via Calendly, it finds the associated lead in Easy Redmine CRM using the invitee‚Äôs email address and logs both a comment and a sales activity in the lead‚Äôs record.  
In addition, the workflow sends an email in Microsoft Outlook, ensuring the account manager can check and knows about the meeting.

Ideal for sales teams and customer success managers, this workflow ensures your CRM and calendar stay updated with every new meeting‚Äîno manual entry required.

## How it works  

**Calendly Trigger**  
- Watches for `invitee.created` events (newly booked meetings)  
- Authenticates with Calendly via OAuth2  

**Get ID from email**  
- Sends a GET request to Easy Redmine CRM to search for a lead using the invitee‚Äôs email  
- Extracts the lead ID, required for further CRM actions  

**Add Comment**  
- Posts a comment to the lead‚Äôs record in Easy Redmine CRM  
- The comment includes:  
 - Invitee‚Äôs full name  
 - Scheduled date/time of the meeting  
 - Meeting description  

**Sales Activity POST**  
- Creates a new sales activity in Easy Redmine CRM under the same lead  
- Includes structured details:  
 - Invitee‚Äôs name  
 - Meeting date and time  
 - Description of the meeting  

**Send an email**  
- Sends a notification email in Microsoft Outlook  
- Maps the name, start time, and description using dynamic values from the Calendly booking  
- Ensures the account manager is informed about the scheduled meeting

## How to Use  

**Import the workflow**  
- Copy or download the JSON of this workflow  
- In your n8n editor, click **Import Workflow** and paste/upload the JSON  

**Set up credentials**  
- *Calendly API*:  
 - Use OAuth2 credentials  
 - Ensure proper scopes for reading event data  
 - Follow n8n‚Äôs setup guide: https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/calendly/  
- *Easy Redmine CRM*:  
 - Add credentials using an API token or OAuth2, depending on your CRM setup  
- *Microsoft Outlook*:  
 - Set up OAuth2 credentials and connect your Outlook email  

**Assign and configure nodes**  
- *Calendly Trigger*:  
 - Confirm it‚Äôs set to listen for `invitee.created`  
- *Get ID from email*:  
 - Update the GET request URL to match your Easy Redmine CRM lead search endpoint  
 - Ensure it uses the invitee‚Äôs email from the trigger  
- *Add Comment & Sales Activity POST*:  
 - Use your Easy Redmine CRM‚Äôs correct endpoints  
 - Map dynamic fields like lead ID, name, meeting time, and description  
- *Send email notification*:  
 - Set up your preferred Outlook email  
 - Map meeting details into email body (e.g. name, time, description)  

**Timezone and formatting**  
- If needed, use a Code node to convert the meeting time if your CRM or Outlook expects a specific format or timezone  

**Test the workflow**  
- Schedule a test meeting via Calendly using an email tied to an existing CRM lead  
- Check Easy Redmine CRM to confirm:  
 - A comment was added  
 - A sales activity was created under the correct lead  
- Check Outlook to confirm:  
 - An email notification was received 

## Example Use Cases  

**Sales Enablement**  
- Log every discovery or demo call automatically, helping reps track all activity in one place  
- Block time in calendars without double-booking risk  

**Customer Success**  
- Keep onboarding and check-in meetings logged, improving visibility across the team  
- Ensure calendar events are created for every scheduled session  

**Lead Qualification**  
- Identify engaged leads based on bookings and trigger follow-up sequences  

## Requirements  
- Calendly account with API access  
- Easy Redmine CRM user with API access  
- Microsoft Outlook account with email access  

## Customization (Optional)  

**Add Filters**  
- Use IF or Switch nodes to handle only specific event types (e.g., demo calls vs intro calls)  

**Extend Comments**  
- Include additional data from Calendly like meeting location or answers to custom questions

workflow.name: Calendly Bookings to Easy Redmine CRM with Comment and Sales Activity

parameters.content:
## Auto-Sync Calendly Bookings to Easy Redmine CRM with Comment, Sales Activity, and Outlook Message
  
**Automatically capture Calendly bookings as CRM activities, comments, and Outlook message to keep your lead records and schedule up to date.**

### About Workflow  
This workflow listens for new bookings in Calendly and automatically updates your Easy Redmine CRM. It first finds the matching lead based on the invitee‚Äôs email address, then logs the meeting as a comment and creates a sales activity in the CRM.  
Additionally, it notify a manager about the meeting in their connected Outlook to ensure visibility across platforms.

Perfect for sales or support teams using Calendly to book meetings but working in Easy Redmine CRM for relationship management, while also managing availability in Outlook.

### Use Case  
Ideal for teams or individuals who schedule meetings with clients or leads through Calendly and want those interactions reflected automatically in the CRM and their calendar.  
- Keeps CRM lead records up to date without manual entry  
- Ensures every meeting is logged for visibility and reporting  
- Adds the meeting to Outlook to avoid scheduling conflicts and improve planning  
- Ideal for sales pipelines, onboarding processes, or support tracking  

## How it works  
- **Calendly Trigger**  
  => Listens for new bookings using the `invitee.created` event  
  => Initiates the workflow when a Calendly meeting is scheduled  

- **Get ID of Account from email**  
  => Searches for the lead/contact in Easy Redmine CRM using the invitee‚Äôs email  
  => If a match is found, proceeds to update the record  

- **Add Comment**  
  => Posts a comment on the lead‚Äôs profile with details from the Calendly booking (invitee name, meeting time, description, etc.)  

- **Sales Activity POST**  
  => Creates a new sales activity entry in the CRM linked to the same lead  
  => Useful for reporting, KPIs, or sales tracking  

- **Send a message**  
  => Sends an email notification to the account manager (or specified user)  
  => Includes a link to the CRM lead and meeting details in the message body  

## How to Use  
1. **Import the workflow** into your n8n instance  
2. **Set up Calendly API access**:  
   - Go to [Calendly Developer Portal](https://developer.calendly.com/)  
   - Create a new app and generate OAuth2 credentials (client ID, secret, redirect URL)  
   - Follow n8n‚Äôs setup guide: https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/calendly/  
3. **Connect your personal Calendly account** using the developer credentials  
4. **Configure Easy Redmine CRM API access**:  
   - Make sure API access is enabled and endpoints are reachable  
   - Provide necessary authentication (e.g., API key or token)  
5. **Connect your Outlook account**:  
   - Use n8n‚Äôs Microsoft Outlook integration with OAuth2  
6. **Customize the nodes if needed**:  
   - `Get ID of Account from email` ‚Üí Confirm the correct API endpoint for lead lookup  
   - `Add Comment` ‚Üí Adjust formatting of the comment to fit your CRM style  
   - `Sales Activity POST` ‚Üí Match data fields to your sales activity schema  
   - `Send a message` ‚Üí Customize the title, time formatting, and description as needed  
7. **Test the workflow** by booking a test Calendly meeting  
   - Confirm that the lead gets updated with a comment, a new sales activity, and an email notification in Outlook  

## Example Use Cases  
- **Sales teams** logging demo or discovery calls directly into CRM  
- **Customer success** tracking onboarding or check-in calls automatically  
- **Support teams** capturing scheduled calls with clients without data loss  
- **Client-facing teams** syncing Calendly meetings to their Outlook calendar  

## Requirements  
- **Calendly account**  
  - With developer access for API credential setup  
- **Easy Redmine CRM**  
  - API enabled and access to comment & activity endpoints  
- **Microsoft Outlook account**  
  - With OAuth2 setup  

## Customization  
- Add conditional logic to only process specific meeting types  
- Include custom formatting or tags in comments (e.g., ‚ÄúDemo call‚Äù)  
- Extend the workflow to create new leads if no match is found  
- Customize Outlook email subject and body  

### Need Help? 
- Reach out through n8n community => https://community.n8n.io/u/easy8.ai
- Contant our team directly => Easy8.ai
- Visit our youtube channel => https://www.youtube.com/@easy8ai

## Auto-Sync Calendly Bookings to Easy Redmine CRM with Comment and Sales Activity  
**1) "Calendly Trigger" ‚Äì trigger workflow on new Calendly booking**  
**2) "Get ID from email" ‚Äì find corresponding Easy Redmine lead based on participant‚Äôs email**  
**3) "Add Comment" ‚Äì add booking details as a comment to the lead**  
**4) "Sales Activity POST" ‚Äì create a related sales activity in Easy Redmine (e.g. meeting, call)**
**5) "Send a message" ‚Äî automaticly sent email to manager to inform them**

# Final Output Example 

## New Comment on the Lead:

**NameOfCommentAuthor** 16 Sep 2025 08:23 AM

Book a demo with Jane Doe on 2025-01-01T12:00:00.000000Z. Meeting description: Lorem Ipsum Lorem Ipsum.

## Sales Activity:

Phone call
		      EntityName
Book a demo with Jane Doe on 2025-01-01T12:00:00.000000Z. Meeting description: Lorem Ipsum Lorem Ipsum.

## Outlook Email  

New Sales Activity was created https://easyredmine.com/easy_leads/123456
Please check your calendar meeting with Jane Doe on 2026-01-01T08:00:00.000000Z.

parameters.comment: =Book a demo with {{ $('Calendly Trigger').item.json.payload.name }} on {{ $('Calendly Trigger').item.json.payload.scheduled_event.start_time }}. Meeting description: {{ $('Calendly Trigger').item.json.payload.questions_and_answers[0].answer }}.

nodes.name: Get ID of Account from email

parameters.subject: =Demo meeting with {{ $('Calendly Trigger').item.json.payload.name }}
parameters.bodyContent:
=New Sales Activity was created https://easyredmine.com/easy_leads/{{ $json.easy_entity_activity.entity.id }}
Please check your calendar meeting with {{ $('Calendly Trigger').item.json.payload.name }} on {{ $('Calendly Trigger').item.json.payload.scheduled_event.start_time }}
